Article Title: Apple discontinues these accessories with the new iPhones
Article Text: Before the launch of iPhone 16 series it was reported that this year Apple will discontinue some of its accessories. Now, after the launch of iPhone 16 series, Apple has discontinued the FineWoven cases.The tech giant has removed the existing FineWoven iPhone cases for older devices from its website. However, FineWoven versions of the MagSafe Wallet and AirTag Key Ring remain available.The FineWoven cases were introduced last year as a more environmentally friendly alternative to leather, but many users found them to be susceptible to dirt and fraying. The discontinuation of the FineWoven cases leaves a void in Apple's accessory lineup, as there is no direct replacement available.For the iPhone 16, customers can now choose between the Silicone Case and the Clear Case. “Apple cases for the iPhone 16 lineup work seamlessly with Camera Control , featuring a sapphire crystal coupled to a conductive layer that communicates finger movements to the Camera Control,” said the company.The silicone case with MagSafe is priced at Rs 4,900 and it is available in multiple colour options — fuchsia, ultramarine, star fruit, and lake green.As mentioned above, the iPhone FineWoven wallet with MagSafe is still available on the Apple website and is priced at Rs 5,900.
Article Summary: The FineWoven cases were introduced last year as a more environmentally friendly alternative to leather. Many users found them to be susceptible to dirt and fraying. The Silicone Case with MagSafe is priced at Rs 4,900 and it is available in multiple colour options — fuchsia, ultramarine, star fruit, and lake green.

Article Title: Apple unveils Visual Intelligence feature to compete with Google Lens
Article Text: Apple launched its latest iPhone 16 series at the 'its Glowtime' event on September 9. The lineup includes four models: iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. Notable features are a redesigned camera and Visual Intelligence, an AI-driven tool for real-time object identification and contextual information via the camera.
Article Summary: Apple launched its latest iPhone 16 series at the 'its Glowtime' event on September 9. The lineup includes four models: iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. Notable features are a redesigned camera and Visual Intelligence, an AI-driven tool for real-time object identification.

Article Title: Apple Intelligence to launch in October with iOS 18.1: Key features and more
Article Text: Apple Intelligence, a new personal intelligence system combining generative models with personal context will roll out next month with iOS 18.1, iPadOS 18.1, and macOS Sequoia 15.1 in U.S.
Article Summary: Apple Intelligence is a new personal intelligence system combining generative models with personal context. It will roll out next month with iOS 18.1, iPadOS 18.2, and macOS Sequoia 15.1 in the U.S.

Article Title: Apple's “It’s Glowtime” event today: Apple Store goes down ahead of iPhone 16 series launch
Article Text:
How to watch Apple's "It's Glowtime" event

Apple's "It's Glowtime" event: iPhone 16 series, Apple Watch Series X, and more to expect

Apple's online store went offline Monday morning, signalling the imminent launch of new products at the company's " It's Glowtime " event. The highly anticipated showcase, scheduled for 10 p.m. IST, is expected to unveil the iPhone 16 lineup , Apple Watch Series X and other devices.Apple’s “It’s Glowtime” event is scheduled to take place today, Monday, September 9, at 10:30 PM IST (10:00 AM PDT).The event will be live-streamed on Apple.com, the Apple TV app, and the company’s YouTube channel.Rumours are rife that Apple would launch four new iPhone models: iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro, and iPhone 16 Pro Max. The new iPhone 16 models are expected to feature a new "Capture Button," the A18 and A18 Pro chips, and upgraded cameras. The Pro models may sport larger displays, with the iPhone 16 Pro potentially featuring a 6.3-inch screen and the Pro Max a 6.9-inch screen.Apple is also expected to reveal the Apple Watch Series X, marking the device's tenth anniversary. Rumours suggest a thinner chassis and larger screens compared to the Series 9. New health features, including sleep apnea detection, may be introduced.The event may also showcase new AirPods models, including a high-end version with active noise cancellation and a budget-friendly option. An update to the AirPods Max with USB-C charging is possible.Software announcements are anticipated, with potential release dates for iOS 18, watchOS 11, and macOS Sequoia. The event's "It's Glowtime" tagline hints at a focus on Apple Intelligence, the company's AI initiatives.Pre-orders for the new devices are likely to begin Friday, September 13, with retail availability expected the following week.Apple typically takes its online store offline before major product launches to update product listings and create anticipation. The store is expected to reopen following the event with listings of the newly announced devices.Read Also | Apple Event 2024 live
Article Summary: Apple's online store went offline Monday morning, signalling the imminent launch of new products. The highly anticipated showcase, scheduled for 10 p.m. IST, is expected to unveil the iPhone 16 lineup. Apple is also expected to reveal the Apple Watch Series X, marking the device's tenth anniversary.

Article Title: Apple event: These are the likely new colours of iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Pro
Article Text:
How to watch Apple's iPhone 16 event

Apple fans, your wait is over. It's Apple iPhone Day today, September 9. In less than 10 hours Apple will unveil the flagship iPhones of 2023 -- iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Plus, iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max. Like all years, one big anticipation is of the new colour options that iPhone 16 will come in.According to Bloomberg's Mark Gurman , the iPhone 16 Pro models will feature a new Gold Titanium finish, replacing the Blue Titanium option seen on the iPhone 15 Pro.The Black, White, and Natural Titanium colours will remain unchanged.Previous rumours about the Pro model colorways were accurate, although the Gold Titanium version was initially described as "bronze-like" with a "Desert Titanium" name. Gurman recently commented that the Gold colour looks impressive and not as bad as some early renders suggested.The iPhone 16 and iPhone 16 Plus are expected to come in White (replacing yellow) and new shades of Green, Pink, and Blue. While Gurman didn't mention a Black option, it's possible it will be offered in a similar shade to the iPhone 15's Black.Apple will unveil the iPhone 16 lineup at its " It's Glowtime " event on Monday, September 9th at 10:30 PM IST. The event will be held at the Steve Jobs Theater on Apple's Cupertino campus and live-streamed online for Apple fans across the globe.Apple fans can watch today's ‘Big Apple Event ’ on Apple's own website, Apple TV app as well as Apple's official YouTube channel.
Article Summary: Apple will unveil the iPhone 16 lineup at its " It's Glowtime " event on Monday, September 9th. The event will be held at the Steve Jobs Theater on Apple's Cupertino campus and live-streamed online for Apple fans across the globe.

Article Title: Italian app developer will lay off 75% of WeTransfer staff after purchase: What company CEO said
Article Text:
What the CEO said

Italian app developer Bending Spoons said it will lay off 75% of WeTransfer employees. According to a report by TechCrunch, the company said that the staff that is being let go will be informed after Bending Spoons goes through local regulations in different countries regarding the layoffs.To recall, the app company acquired the Dutch-based file transfer service in July for an undisclosed amount.In February, Bending Spoons raised $155 million taking the company's valuation to $2.55 billion.Bending Spoons CEO Luca Ferrari told the publication “Once the vision is clear, we try to close the gap between the status quo and the vision as quickly and as fully as we can. Typically, doing so involves making major changes to many areas, including the organisation. While we don’t enjoy making painful or unpopular decisions, we’re prepared to do so when we believe it’s the right thing to do to help the business thrive.”Adding that in WeTransfer’s case, Bending Spoons wanted to have a small and focused team, he stated “In this particular case, the vision we developed is of a smaller, more sharply focused WeTransfer organisation, which we believe will be better-positioned to serve WeTransfer’s success with a long-term view.”The TechCrunch report says that the planned layoffs at WeTransfer are not surprising as Bending Spoons regularly cuts the headcount of companies. These job cuts are aimed to operate them profitably. For example, in February 2023, the company cut 129 employees from Evernote’s staff. It did the same in December 2023 when it let go the entire workforce of Filmic, the popular photo and video editing app that it acquired in 2022.
Article Summary: Italian app developer Bending Spoons said it will lay off 75% of WeTransfer employees. The company acquired the Dutch-based file transfer service in July for an undisclosed amount. In February, Benders Spoons raised $155 million taking the company's valuation to $2.55 billion.

The widely popular Telegram-based crypto tap-to-earn game has just revealed the code word and card combinations that could earn you up to 6 million tokens for free.Since its launch in March 2024, Hamster Kombat has seen explosive growth, attracting over 200 million users globally. The viral clicker game centers around a Hamster who acts as the CEO of a simulated virtual crypto exchange.Players are tasked with supporting this ambitious rodent by mining coins and upgrading the exchange’s level.As a reward for their efforts, players can earn free bonuses. Mining in Hamster Kombat is simple—just tap on the Hamster icon until your energy bar is depleted.The Daily Cipher Code and Combo Card are special challenges within the game designed to reward players with even more tokens. The Daily Cipher Code is a task where players must decipher a word using Morse code. Successfully cracking the code within the 24-hour time limit can earn you 1 million coins.The Daily Combo Card is a challenge that requires players to correctly choose three cards from the game’s upgrade categories: PR & Team, Markets, Legal, Specials, and Web3. Completing this challenge can net you an additional 5 million coins. Like the Cipher Code, the Combo Card is updated daily.The Hamster Kombat Daily Cipher code for today is “260924” Enter the code using the Morse sheet given below and earn up to 1 million coins.▬ Long Tap● Short TapToday's special cars was "A pair of skis"

Article Title: Elon Musk launches X TV Beta to revolutionise streaming and social media: Check out it features, usage tips, and other details you must know
Article Text:
X TV beta launch and platform integration

Musk’s X TV key features

Replay TV

Startover TV

Free Cloud DVR

Musk’s vision: Transforming X into a multimedia powerhouse

Future integrations and expectations

Also read

Elon Musk , the CEO of Tesla Motors and visionary entrepreneur, has once again made headlines by launching the beta version of X TV , a new feature within the X app (formerly known as Twitter). This innovative addition is set to transform the way users consume films, live content, and recorded shows, all within the X ecosystem. By reducing reliance on external media platforms, Musk aims to consolidate entertainment and social interaction into a single space, enhancing user experience and keeping them engaged for longer periods.The beta release of X TV, unveiled on September 3, 2024, is currently available to a select group of users, whose feedback will be critical in shaping the platform’s future updates.On September 3, 2024, Musk took to his X account to announce the beta release of X TV:Although not yet available to the general public, the beta version is being tested by early adopters who are actively exploring its functionalities. The app is currently optimised for Android TVs but will soon be integrated with LG, Amazon Fire TV, and Google TV. Musk’s team has hinted at more platform expansions in the future, allowing a wider range of users to experience X TV.The beta phase is essential for collecting user feedback and making improvements before a full-scale launch. Musk has a history of leveraging user insights to fine-tune new features, and X TV is expected to follow this same iterative development model.X TV boasts several innovative features that set it apart from traditional streaming platforms. These features are designed to provide flexibility, control, and an enhanced user experience.One of the standout features is Replay TV, which allows users to store up to 72 hours of shows in the cloud. This feature ensures that users never miss a favourite program, even if they are unable to watch it live. Replay TV provides the freedom to catch up on missed content at any time within the 72-hour window, making it perfect for today’s on-the-go lifestyle.For those who tune in late to a live broadcast, Startover TV offers a game-changing solution. This feature enables viewers to restart any live show from the very beginning, ensuring they don’t miss crucial moments. Whether it's a live sporting event, a news broadcast, or a favourite TV show, Startover TV ensures that viewers can enjoy the full experience, regardless of when they begin watching.One of the most user-friendly features is Free Cloud DVR, which allows users to record up to 100 hours of content at no extra cost. This feature is particularly appealing to those who wish to store a wide range of content, from movies to series, without worrying about additional fees. By offering this feature for free, X TV positions itself as a cost-effective alternative to other streaming services that charge for cloud storage.The launch of X TV represents a significant step in Musk’s vision to turn X from a simple microblogging platform into a comprehensive multimedia hub. While the X app has long been known for its ability to disseminate real-time information and updates, the addition of X TV seeks to broaden its appeal by incorporating a variety of media experiences within the same platform.This integration is not just about expanding content options; it’s about increasing user engagement. By offering movies, live broadcasts, and recorded content, X TV gives users more reasons to stay on the platform, thus reducing the need to switch between multiple apps or services.X TV is also expected to encourage content creators, influencers, and media companies to engage with the X app more fully. The potential for live-streamed events, interactive programming, and user-generated content creates new avenues for growth and user interaction.As the X TV beta continues to roll out, additional features and platform integrations are expected in the near future. These updates may include broader compatibility with Apple TV, Roku, and other streaming devices, further increasing the app’s reach. Musk has also hinted at potential partnerships with media companies, which could lead to exclusive content being available on X TV.Furthermore, there is speculation about possible AI-driven content recommendations that would help personalise the user experience. Given Musk’s interest in AI and its integration across his companies, such a feature could be a logical next step for X TV.Another area to watch is social viewing, where users could watch content together with friends, share reactions in real-time, and discuss events as they unfold. Such features would help X TV maintain its social roots while expanding its media capabilities.
Article Summary: X TV is a new feature within the X app (formerly known as Twitter) It is set to transform the way users consume films, live content, and recorded shows. By reducing reliance on external media platforms, Musk aims to consolidate entertainment and social interaction into a single space. The beta release of X TV is currently available to a select group of users.

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

The primary objective of the game is to build and upgrade villages, while simultaneously attacking and defending against those belonging to other players, including your friends.To excel in Coin Master, players must effectively defend their villages, collect rewards, and progress quickly.The game's core mechanic revolves around a virtual slot machine that awards players with various rewards, including coins, shields, and weapons. In Coin Master, characters embark on time-travelling adventures, adopting roles such as pirates, hippies, kings, warriors, and Vikings, among others.Players accumulate spins, which can be used to earn rewards such as coins, shields, and opportunities to attack or raid other players' villages. Here’s what you can expect from the slot machine:Players can also perform a "Super Bet," wagering multiple spins simultaneously for potentially greater rewards.Players can also earn spins and coins by collecting thematic cards to complete collections, which unlock rewards like pets, spins, and coins; card collection begins at the third village, and cards can be traded with friends to complete sets faster.Pets, including Foxy (increases raid rewards), Rhino (enhances village defence), and Tiger (boosts attack rewards), play a key role by offering various bonuses as they level up. To maintain pets, players need to provide food, which can be obtained from the store, special events, or the slot machine.Spins are crucial in Coin Master as they enable participation in the slot machine. The game's core mechanic revolves around a virtual slot machine that awards players with various rewards, including coins, shields, and weapons.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Donald Trump has found a role for Elon Musk in the US government
Article Text: Donald Trump announced his intention to form a government efficiency commission with Elon Musk as its head if he is elected President. The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US-based companies.
Article Summary: The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US- based companies. The commission will be headed by Elon Musk if he is elected President.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.

Article Title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal slams Elon Musk’ X: “just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court”
Article Text:
Take a look at Bhavish Aggarwal’s post on X

Elon Musk criticizes Brazil ban on X



Delhi High Court warns Wikipedia

Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has once again reiterated his stance on fostering the Indian technology sector. Aggarwal took to microblogging site X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non-compliance with Indian laws.In the post, he wrote “Another proof of why we need to build our tech stack in India. These platforms don’t even comply with Indian laws and then even ignore court judgements!”.But he did not stop there.Aggarwal took aim at Elon Musk 's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident to slam the platform. He said “Also, just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court .”“The more we ignore and justify, more we risk,” he further added.Recently, Brazil Supreme Court banned X after a protracted legal battle. The battle started in April this year when Judge de Moraes directed X to suspend several accounts alleged to be disseminating false information. X's refusal to follow this order resulted in the current suspension in addition to a penalty of 50,000 reais (approximately Rs. 7.47 lakh) for any efforts to bypass the ban, including the use of VPNs.Elon Musk reacted to the announcement with fury, dubbing Moraes as ‘evil dictator’.The Delhi High Court threatened Wikipedia to block the website if it doesn’t comply with India’s laws. Justice Navin Chawla delivered the warning during a hearing related to a defamation case filed by news agency ANI against Wikipedia."If you don't like India, please don't work in India... We will ask government to block your site," Justice Chawla declared, as reported by legal news website Bar and Bench.
Article Summary: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non- compliance with Indian laws. He also took aim at Elon Musk's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident.
